title: Android 13 DP1 allows Google Pixel 6 to run full-fledged Windows 11 as a VM
content:
If you are familiar with Windows 11, you have almost certainly heard of Windows Subsystem of Android. Microsoft constructed its Android compatibly layer on the foundation of Windows Subsystem for Linux, which is based on the company’s Hyper-V virtualization platform. Google took a similar approach while designing the Linux app functionality in Chrome OS, but

The post Android 13 DP1 allows Google Pixel 6 to run full-fledged Windows 11 as a VM appeared first on xda-developers.
description: The Android 13 DP1 unlocks the full KVM functionality on the Google Pixel 6 and 6 Pro. You can now boot Windows 11 and Linux VMs on these phones.
